title: U.S. edges Japan 2-1, advances to WBC championship game
text:
U.S. edges Japan 2-1, advances to WBC championship game U.S. will play Puerto Rico in final Share this: Click to share on Tumblr (Opens in new window) Chris Carlson, The Associated Press United States’ Buster Posey and Luke Gregerson celebrate after the United States defeated Japan, 2-1, in a semifinal in the World Baseball Classic in Los Angeles, Tuesday, March 21, 2017. By Greg Beacham | The Associated Press PUBLISHED: March 21, 2017 at 10:34 pm | UPDATED: Noah Smith: U.S. science spending pays off bigly 
LOS ANGELES — Brandon Crawford scored the tiebreaking run when Nobuhiro Matsuda bobbled Adam Jones’ grounder to third in the eighth inning, and the United States reached the championship game of the World Baseball Classic for the first time by beating Japan 2-1 on Tuesday night at rainy Dodger Stadium. 
Andrew McCutchen drove in an early run for the U.S., which will play Puerto Rico for the title Wednesday night. Puerto Rico beat the Netherlands 4-3 in 11 innings Monday. 
The World Baseball Classic final has been played in the U.S. in each of its four editions, but the home team had never made it. Related Articles 
The Americans only reached the semifinals once, in 2009. But this All-Star-laden roster has won two straight elimination games to earn the chance for its first crown.
